forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 59. West southwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. West wind 10 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As dusk settles over Downtown San Francisco, a soft layer of clouds blankets the skyline, casting the city in a gentle gray hue. The air whispers of the mild maritime influence, hinting at the slight possibility of drizzle that could accompany the night. A west-southwest wind rustles through the streets, carrying the scent of the ocean, and a cool balm settles in as temperatures drift toward the low sixties. The chance of precipitation is low, a mere whisper at 20%, yet the city’s character remains undeniably wrapped in a light-hearted veil of uncertainty.

Looking to tomorrow, the sun promises to peek through the clouds early in the day, teasing a more vibrant afternoon on the horizon. With temperatures reaching into the upper sixties and a refreshing breeze picking up, it suggests an opportunity for a light jaunt along the waterfront or perhaps a quiet moment in one of the city’s parks. Attire best suited for this shifting weather includes layered garments, perhaps a light jacket or a cozy sweater for the morning, giving way to comfort as the sun warms the day. Whether indulging in a casual stroll, embracing the last remnants of summer at a café terrace, or simply savoring a book amidst the changing sky, this evening offers a serene backdrop to the ever-evolving tapestry of city life.
